## WACC and Value Creation Threshold A firm has **Equity = \$182m**, **Debt = \$184m**, **Re = 12**%, **Rd = 5.8**%, **Tax = 26**%. Compute the **WACC** (after tax). ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Concept:** WACC is the **blended required return** from shareholders and debtholders, after the **interest tax shield**. Formula: WACC = (E/V)·Re + (D/V)·Rd·(1 − T). **Your numbers:** WACC = (182/366)×12% + (184/366)×5.8%×(1−26%) = **8.12%**.
::: Suppose a project in this firm has **expected return = 11.4%**. By how many **percentage points** does the project’s return **exceed the WACC**? (This gap signals **value creation** if positive.) ::: {.question-block}
✅ **Decision rule:** If **Project Return > WACC**, the project **creates value** (positive NPV under proportional scaling). **Your numbers:** Gap = 11.4% − 8.12% = **3.28 pp**. A positive gap indicates the project clears the firm’s opportunity cost of capital.
:::
